title: BBC deputy director Anne Bulford sees her pay hit £435,000
text: Share this article Share Another top earner is BBC ‘superwoman’ Charlotte Moore, who was paid £325,000 last year — more than twice the Prime Minister’s salary. Theresa May, earns £149,440 a year. The 48-year-old — who is in charge of all of the BBC’s TV and iPlayer content — was handed a £30,000 pay increase when she was promoted to the job in January 2016. She was previously controller of BBC1, where her £295,000-a-year salary already made her one of the highest-paid executives in television. It is not the first time Moore has stirred controversy. Last year, she was forced to quit her husband’s TV company over an ‘astonishing’ conflict of interests. Moore spent the past nine years as company secretary of Perry Images, owned by her husband Johann Perry. The firm had profited handsomely from the BBC commissions, including some which Moore commissioned. If planners give it the green light, perhaps Lord Bath’s harem of wifelets can check in. KATE MOSS DOESN'T CHANGE HER SPOTS Kate Moss marked turning 43 last month by posing naked for a magazine. In exhibitionist style, Moss flashed her saucy black leather underwear underneath her leopard-print shirt as she reclined on a chair and puffed on a cigarette during a dinner date with friends. Kate recently conf-essed she felt self-conscious about her body when she started modelling, aged 14. How times have changed.
